user.title: SFML Stats - Basic Settings
user.description: Configure statistics generation for Solar Forecast ML.

data_description.generate_weekly: Create a weekly report every Sunday
data_description.generate_monthly: Create a monthly report on the 1st of each month
data_description.theme: Dark or Light theme for the charts

energy_flow.title: Energy Flow Sensors
energy_flow.description:
Select sensors for the energy flow diagram.

All fields are optional! Only select the sensors you have available.

Sensors must provide current power in Watts (W).

data_description.sensor_solar_power: Current PV power in Watts. Usually from your inverter.
data_description.sensor_solar_to_house: Power flowing directly from PV to house (without battery/grid).
data_description.sensor_solar_to_battery: Power flowing from PV to battery.
data_description.sensor_grid_to_house: Grid import for direct house consumption (without battery charging).

battery.title: Battery & Consumption
battery.description:
Sensors for battery status and home consumption.

All fields are optional!

SOC in percent (%), power in Watts (W).

data_description.sensor_battery_soc: State of Charge in percent (0-100%). Battery charge level.
data_description.sensor_battery_power: Current charge or discharge power in Watts. Displayed below battery icon.
data_description.sensor_battery_to_house: Only the discharge power flowing to house (in Watts). For Battery → House flow.
data_description.sensor_battery_to_grid: Battery discharge to grid (in Watts). For Battery → Grid flow.
data_description.sensor_home_consumption: Total current home consumption in Watts. Displayed in house icon.

statistics.title: Statistics Sensors (optional)
statistics.description:
Sensors for daily and yearly statistics.

All fields are optional!

Peaks and production data are automatically read from Solar Forecast ML data!

data_description.sensor_solar_yield_daily: Total PV production today in kWh (e.g. from your inverter).
data_description.sensor_grid_import_daily: Total grid import today in kWh.
data_description.sensor_grid_import_yearly: Total grid import this year in kWh.
data_description.sensor_battery_charge_solar_daily: Energy charged from PV to battery today (kWh).
data_description.sensor_battery_charge_grid_daily: Energy charged from grid to battery today (kWh).
data_description.sensor_price_total: Current total electricity price incl. all fees in ct/kWh.
data_description.weather_entity: HA Weather integration for comparison with AI-corrected data.

panels.title: PV Panel Sensors (optional)
panels.description:
Configure up to 4 individual PV panels.

All fields are optional!

For each panel you can specify a name and a live watt sensor.

billing.title: Electricity Bill & Billing Period
billing.description:
Configure your billing period for the annual balance.

Enter the start date of your electricity bill (e.g. if your provider bills on January 15th, select Day=15, Month=January).

kWh sensors must be 'total_increasing' - the difference from the start value is calculated.

data_description.billing_start_day: Day of month when your billing period starts (1-28).
data_description.billing_start_month: Month when your billing period starts.
data_description.billing_price_mode: Dynamic = actual hourly prices from Grid Price Monitor. Fixed = your tariff price.
data_description.billing_fixed_price: Your electricity tariff price in cents per kWh (only for fixed price mode).
data_description.sensor_smartmeter_import_kwh: Meter reading grid import in kWh (total_increasing). Start value from Recorder.
data_description.sensor_smartmeter_export_kwh: Meter reading grid export in kWh (total_increasing). Start value from Recorder.
data_description.sensor_solar_yield_total_kwh: Total solar yield in kWh (total_increasing). Start value from Recorder.

abort.raspberry_pi_not_supported: Installation on Raspberry Pi is not supported. This integration uses matplotlib for chart generation, which causes performance issues and high CPU load on Raspberry Pi. Please use a more powerful system (x86_64 or a powerful ARM server).
abort.proxmox_not_recommended: Installation on Proxmox VE host detected. Please note: Home Assistant should run in a VM or LXC container, not directly on the Proxmox host. The matplotlib-based chart generation may cause performance issues on the Proxmox host. Please install Home Assistant in a dedicated VM or LXC container.
